meanings.definition: The most serious part of a complaint or accusation.
meanings.sent1: In the lawsuit, the gravamen was the accusation of fraud.
meanings.sent2: The gravamen of the complaint was the claim of theft.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer emphasized the gravamen of the case with passion.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes fixed on the gravamen of the matter, piercing through the confusion.
meanings.sent5: The gravamen of the accusation lingered in the courtroom, casting a shadow over the proceedings.

meanings.definition: The essence or main point of a legal case.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the gravamen of the legal case is crucial for the defense.
meanings.sent2: The judge focused on the gravamen of the argument presented.
meanings.sent3: The gravamen of the case became clear after reviewing the evidence.
meanings.sent4: She grasped the gravamen of the legal issue, unraveling its complexity.
meanings.sent5: The gravamen of the legal case resonated with the jury, swaying their decision.

meanings.definition: The central or essential point of an argument.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, the gravamen of the argument became evident.
meanings.sent2: His speech lacked the gravamen needed to persuade the audience.
meanings.sent3: The gravamen of the discussion sparked a lively exchange of ideas.
meanings.sent4: She eloquently presented the gravamen of her viewpoint, captivating the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The gravamen of the argument echoed in their minds, leaving a lasting impression.
